page.title: 06LEEDS TO SELBY RAILWAY
page.content: At the top of the block there is the Leeds to Selby railway,which was opened on the 22nd October 1834,It cost Â£210,000 to be made.But when the line was built they had some difficulties for instance the 200 yard tunnel through Richmond Hill outside Leeds and another bridge near Garforth.The fare from Leeds to Selby was 3s(15p) first class.In an old book it told us about an accident near to Hambleton station(there is no trace of a station before)which happened on the 5th May 1853.The accident was an engine running of the line causing the death of John Thompson the engine driver and Joseph Sykes the stoker.Nowadays diesel trains travel on the line going to Leeds to Selby York and Hull.
